title.narrative: Newton Fund - Membrane material testing & modelling for urban transformations, sustainability & efficiency

description.narrative: The proposed project will represent a completely new collaboration established as a result of common interests and research in the same subject. The Brazilian partners have developed a method for constitutive relations for new materials and the UK partners have the expertise in experimental analysis and constitutive material modelling. The partnership will promote the improvement of technologies for membrane structures and offer novel solutions for transformable urban spaces.

capital-spend.percentage: Hypothesis By developing a collaborative research programme on membrane, foil, and composite materials that will deliver innovation in new energy efficient structural building skins to transform urban environments. Specific objectives: 1. Initiate a long-term collaboration between the Brazilian and UK research institutions. 2. Transfer knowledge on membrane, foil, and composite material testing and numerical modelling at both material and structure levels. 3. Undertake biaxial and shear tests in the UK on membranes of different fibre and laminate types. 4. Validate candidate constitutive models and analysis approaches: isotropic and orthotropic hyperelastic, elastoplastic, visco-elastic models, NURBS-material response surfaces, neural networks strain-stress algorithms. 5. Simulate the behaviour of structural membranes based on numerical models adopting the constitutive models and analysis approaches established the test results. 6. Disseminate the research outcomes to the graduate and undergraduate students of UDESC, PUC-Rio, and Newcastle University. 7. Publish the research in high impact factor journals.
